main event: A possible satellite was observed on radar and visually in the sky near Antarctica.
interesting points: The object was spotted on radar on March 5, 1962 heading towards the pole.
When observed on radar on March 7, 1962, the object's tracking was similar to a satellite but its brightness was higher than a typical satellite.
The object was visually observed on March 25, 1962 at 0302SZ in the sky near Antarctica, traveling west and appearing as bright as a first magnitude star.
The object was believed to be a satellite, but its brightness was higher than expected for a satellite.
The observation lasted for 20 minutes on March 7, 1962.
